summary.long: Lamentations is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text:
How lonely sits the city
    that was full of people!
How like a widow has she become,
    she who was great among the nations!
She who was a princess among the provinces
    has become a slave.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
From the daughter of Zion
    all her majesty has departed.
Her princes have become like deer
    that find no pasture;
they fled without strength
    before the pursuer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Jerusalem remembers
    in the days of her affliction and wandering
all the precious things
    that were hers from days of old.
When her people fell into the hand of the foe,
    and there was none to help her,
her foes gloated over her;
    they mocked at her downfall.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The enemy has stretched out his hands
    over all her precious things;
for she has seen the nations
    enter her sanctuary,
those whom you forbade
    to enter your congregation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All her people groan
    as they search for bread;
they trade their treasures for food
    to revive their strength.
“Look, O Lord, and see,
    for I am despised.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Is it nothing to you, all you who pass by?
    Look and see
if there is any sorrow like my sorrow,
    which was brought upon me,
which the Lord inflicted
    on the day of his fierce anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
“I called to my lovers,
    but they deceived me;
my priests and elders
    perished in the city,
while they sought food
    to revive their strength.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
How the Lord in his anger
    has set the daughter of Zion under a cloud!
He has cast down from heaven to earth
    the splendour of Israel;
he has not remembered his footstool
    in the day of his anger.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He has laid waste his booth like a garden,
    laid in ruins his meeting place;
the Lord has made Zion forget
    festival and Sabbath,
and in his fierce indignation has spurned king and priest.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They cry to their mothers,
    “Where is bread and wine?”
as they faint like a wounded man
    in the streets of the city,
as their life is poured out
    on their mothers' bosom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What can I say for you, to what compare you,
    O daughter of Jerusalem?
What can I liken to you, that I may comfort you,
    O virgin daughter of Zion?
For your ruin is vast as the sea;
    who can heal you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your prophets have seen for you
    false and deceptive visions;
they have not exposed your iniquity
    to restore your fortunes,
but have seen for you oracles
    that are false and misleading.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All who pass along the way
    clap their hands at you;
they hiss and wag their heads
    at the daughter of Jerusalem:
“Is this the city that was called
    the perfection of beauty,
    the joy of all the earth?”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Their heart cried to the Lord.
    O wall of the daughter of Zion,
let tears stream down like a torrent
    day and night!
Give yourself no rest,
    your eyes no respite!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Arise, cry out in the night,
    at the beginning of the night watches!
Pour out your heart like water
    before the presence of the Lord!
Lift your hands to him
    for the lives of your children,
who faint for hunger
    at the head of every street.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look, O Lord, and see!
    With whom have you dealt thus?
Should women eat the fruit of their womb,
    the children of their tender care?
Should priest and prophet be killed
    in the sanctuary of the Lord?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
You summoned as if to a festival day
    my terrors on every side,
and on the day of the anger of the Lord
    no one escaped or survived;
those whom I held and raised
    my enemy destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am the man who has seen affliction
    under the rod of his wrath;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has driven and brought me
    into darkness without any light;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
surely against me he turns his hand
    again and again the whole day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has made my flesh and my skin waste away;
    he has broken my bones;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has besieged and enveloped me
    with bitterness and tribulation;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has made me dwell in darkness
    like the dead of long ago.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has walled me about so that I cannot escape;
    he has made my chains heavy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
though I call and cry for help,
    he shuts out my prayer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he has blocked my ways with blocks of stones;
    he has made my paths crooked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is a bear lying in wait for me,
    a lion in hiding;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he turned aside my steps and tore me to pieces;
    he has made me desolate;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
he bent his bow and set me
    as a target for his arrow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He drove into my kidneys
    the arrows of his quiver;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have become the laughing-stock of all peoples,
    the object of their taunts all day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has filled me with bitterness;
    he has sated me with wormwood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He has made my teeth grind on gravel,
    and made me cower in ashes;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my soul is bereft of peace;
    I have forgotten what happiness is;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
so I say, “My endurance has perished;
    so has my hope from the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember my affliction and my wanderings,
    the wormwood and the gall!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul continually remembers it
    and is bowed down within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But this I call to mind,
    and therefore I have hope:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases;
    his mercies never come to an end;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they are new every morning;
    great is your faithfulness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“The Lord is my portion,” says my soul,
    “therefore I will hope in him.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord is good to those who wait for him,
    to the soul who seeks him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good that one should wait quietly
    for the salvation of the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is good for a man that he bear
    the yoke in his youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let him sit alone in silence
    when it is laid on him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
let him put his mouth in the dust—
    there may yet be hope;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
let him give his cheek to the one who strikes,
    and let him be filled with insults.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the Lord will not
    cast off for ever,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
but, though he cause grief, he will have compassion
    according to the abundance of his steadfast love;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for he does not willingly afflict
    or grieve the children of men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To crush underfoot
    all the prisoners of the earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to deny a man justice
    in the presence of the Most High,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
to subvert a man in his lawsuit,
    the Lord does not approve.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who has spoken and it came to pass,
    unless the Lord has commanded it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it not from the mouth of the Most High
    that good and bad come?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why should a living man complain,
    a man, about the punishment of his sins?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us test and examine our ways,
    and return to the Lord!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us lift up our hearts and hands
    to God in heaven:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“We have transgressed and rebelled,
    and you have not forgiven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You have wrapped yourself with anger and pursued us,
    killing without pity;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you have wrapped yourself with a cloud
    so that no prayer can pass through.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have made us filth and rubbish
    among the peoples.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“All our enemies
    open their mouths against us;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
panic and pitfall have come upon us,
    devastation and destruction;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my eyes flow with rivers of tears
    because of the destruction of the daughter of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“My eyes will flow without ceasing,
    without respite,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
until the Lord from heaven
    looks down and sees;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
my eyes cause me grief
    at the fate of all the daughters of my city.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I have been hunted like a bird
    by those who were my enemies without cause;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
they flung me alive into the pit
    and cast stones on me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
water closed over my head;
    I said, ‘I am lost.’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“I called on your name, O Lord,
    from the depths of the pit;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
you heard my plea, ‘Do not close
    your ear to my cry for help!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You came near when I called on you;
    you said, ‘Do not fear!’
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You have taken up my cause, O Lord;
    you have redeemed my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have seen the wrong done to me, O Lord;
    judge my cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You have seen all their vengeance,
    all their plots against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You have heard their taunts, O Lord,
    all their plots against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lips and thoughts of my assailants
    are against me all the day long.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold their sitting and their rising;
    I am the object of their taunts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“You will repay them, O Lord,
    according to the work of their hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will give them dullness of heart;
    your curse will be on them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
You will pursue them in anger and destroy them
    from under your heavens, O Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How the gold has grown dim,
    how the pure gold is changed!
The holy stones lie scattered
    at the head of every street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The precious sons of Zion,
    worth their weight in fine gold,
how they are regarded as earthen pots,
    the work of a potter's hands!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even jackals offer the breast;
    they nurse their young,
but the daughter of my people has become cruel,
    like the ostriches in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The tongue of the nursing infant sticks
    to the roof of its mouth for thirst;
the children beg for food,
    but no one gives to them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those who once feasted on delicacies
    perish in the streets;
those who were brought up in purple
    embrace ash heaps.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the chastisement of the daughter of my people has been greater
    than the punishment of Sodom,
which was overthrown in a moment,
    and no hands were wrung for her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her princes were purer than snow,
    whiter than milk;
their bodies were more ruddy than coral,
    the beauty of their form was like sapphire.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Happier were the victims of the sword
    than the victims of hunger,
who wasted away, pierced
    by lack of the fruits of the field.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The hands of compassionate women
    have boiled their own children;
they became their food
    during the destruction of the daughter of my people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Lord gave full vent to his wrath;
    he poured out his hot anger,
and he kindled a fire in Zion
    that consumed its foundations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The kings of the earth did not believe,
    nor any of the inhabitants of the world,
that foe or enemy could enter
    the gates of Jerusalem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This was for the sins of her prophets
    and the iniquities of her priests,
who shed in the midst of her
    the blood of the righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They wandered, blind, through the streets;
    they were so defiled with blood
that no one was able to touch
    their garments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
“Away! Unclean!” people cried at them.
    “Away! Away! Do not touch!”
So they became fugitives and wanderers;
    people said among the nations,
    “They shall stay with us no longer.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Our eyes failed, ever watching
    vainly for help;
in our watching we watched
    for a nation which could not save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They dogged our steps
    so that we could not walk in our streets;
our end drew near; our days were numbered,
    for our end had come.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The breath of our nostrils, the Lord's anointed,
    was captured in their pits,
of whom we said, “Under his shadow
    we shall live among the nations.”
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, O Lord, what has befallen us;
    look, and see our disgrace!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers,
    our homes to foreigners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have become orphans, fatherless;
    our mothers are like widows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We must pay for the water we drink;
    the wood we get must be bought.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our pursuers are at our necks;
    we are weary; we are given no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We have given the hand to Egypt, and to Assyria,
    to get bread enough.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our fathers sinned, and are no more;
    and we bear their iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Slaves rule over us;
    there is none to deliver us from their hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
We get our bread at the peril of our lives,
    because of the sword in the wilderness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Our skin is hot as an oven
    with the burning heat of famine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Women are raped in Zion,
    young women in the towns of Judah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Princes are hung up by their hands;
    no respect is shown to the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Young men are compelled to grind at the mill,
    and boys stagger under loads of wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The old men have left the city gate,
    the young men their music.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The joy of our hearts has ceased;
    our dancing has been turned to mourning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The crown has fallen from our head;
    woe to us, for we have sinned!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For this our heart has become sick,
    for these things our eyes have grown dim,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
for Mount Zion which lies desolate;
    jackals prowl over it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But you, O Lord, reign for ever;
    your throne endures to all generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do you forget us for ever,
    why do you forsake us for so many days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Restore us to yourself, O Lord, that we may be restored!
    Renew our days as of old—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
unless you have utterly rejected us,
    and you remain exceedingly angry with us.
verses.speaker: Narrator
